Here's what the the video thumbnail looks like right now:
image.png

after hitting the play button:
image.png

We should also have some discussion regarding what should be the size of the these previews as discussed here.
Are we controlling how the play button looks?
Yes

My thought is that the size should probably be in line with image previews, but of course that's complicated because the video actually plays inline--meaning users might reasonably expect a larger size when watching the videos.
Video preview should be small as images
I suggest to make video preview at least twice as big
Maintaining aspect ration of hd
See and I guess that's my issue--clicking an image preview shows the image in the image viewer; but clicking a video preview just plays the video.

Vlad Korobov said:

I suggest to make video preview at least twice as big

So don't make video previews the same size as images?
Video should be same size as images
Video should be inline block
Video is the heaviest information density per time that humanity has :smile: it deserves to be a block
Right. I'm still confused about the size. On the one hand, you say "Video should be same size as images," but on the other you say "make video preview at least twice as big"
Sorry, writing from the phone Should not be
Unless you don’t want them to be playable inline
Ah okay. That makes sense :)
And make the videos display as blocks, rather than inline-blocks, so there's only one video per line?
So if we want to play videos inline they could be even 3 times bigger than image preview… at least 360 px height
But if we want them to be playable in the media viewer we can make video previews of the same height as images with a play icon in the middle

image.png
Right now they are 250px x 150px
What size would you guys recommend?
If we play them inline height should be at least 360 and the width 640
I suggest to not have a purple fill on the play icon
What should be the fill color then?
Nothing
15% transparent black

That won't work
image.png

Vlad Korobov said:

If we play them inline height should be at least 360 and the width 640

image.png

Looks too big?
That does look a bit oversize to me, too.

With the background colors, I think it would be good to move away from transparency to set colors. It's okay if Vlad wants to communicate the colors that way from his mocks, but we should be screenshotting and then sampling the colors to get versions without an alpha.
Screenshotting and sampling colors doesn’t work well anymore now that most platforms are doing complicated color management (True Tone, Night Shift, Adobe RGB, DCI-P3, HDR, …).
True, but a I think system-level color meter like macOS's Digital Color Meter can report the sRGB color space from a displayed source independent of any color management going on.

Do we actually want to offer inline video playback outside the lightbox? My concept had been that the preview would just be a thumbnail and you'd click it to open in the lightbox where it'd be setup to play at a reasonable scale.

That way we can keep them the same size as other images in the message feed, rather than trying to figure out some intermediate size where you can kinda see what's happening but it's not enormous/disruptive to the feed itself.

image.png
This is Google Fonts Icon + semi transparent black background
play_circle_FILL0_wght400_GRAD0_opsz48-1.svg

In normal state please make this icon 80% transparent and when hovered over the thumbnail make it 100%

Tim Abbott said:

Do we actually want to offer inline video playback outside the lightbox? My concept had been that the preview would just be a thumbnail and you'd click it to open in the lightbox where it'd be setup to play at a reasonable scale.

While inline video playback could be useful, I think it makes sense to introduce this feature as being only playable in lighbox and then introduce inline video playback later if there is user demand for it.
That might also help encourage movement on the redesigned lightbox @Vlad Korobov proposed
Updated #20449 to accomodate these changes.
